Game Status
Game Over

Rules
1. No outside communication about this game unless your role permits it.
2. Don't quote your Role PM or any out-of-thread communications. Don't fake-quote it, either. Paraphrasing is fine.
3. Do not edit/delete your posts.
4. To vote somebody, either bold your vote, such as vote: ChaosOmega, or use vote tags, such as VOTE: ChaosOmega. If your vote isn't bolded or vote tagged, it will not count. Unvotes are not necessary to change your vote.
5. During the day, a player will be lynched when they have more than 50% of the players currently alive voting for them. Once that amount has been reached, they're dead. No unvotes will save them. Players can post in the thread up until I post the lynch scene and the thread is locked.
6. Once it has been posted by me that you are dead, you're dead. Do not post any more, not even a bah post.
7. Every day will have a deadline of 2 weeks. Extensions will be given for extreme circumstances.
8. Nights will have a deadline of 2 days. If you have a night action and do not send one, you will do nothing.
9. If you're going to be gone for longer than a 48-hour period, post in-thread letting everyone know for how long. If 48 hours pass without a player posting or saying they will be absent, I will prod them. For the purposes of this rule, the weekend counts as 24 hours.
10. If a player would receive a fourth prod (unless it is their first prod of the day) or they have not responded to a prod within 24 hours, I will search for a replacement for them.
11. #0040FF is my color. Don't use it. Also, no small or invisible text or cryptography.
12. Please PM me if you have any questions about the game.
13. Have fun.
14. If anyone breaks any of the aforementioned rules, I have complete control over the actions that will be taken.

Sample Townie Role PM
You are a Townie. Your only weapons are your mind and your vote. Use them wisely.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one member of the town is still alive.

Please confirm by sending your role to me via PM.
Role PMs are going out now. When I receive 11/13 confirmations, Day 1 will begin.

It is now Day 1. With 13 alive, it takes 7 to lynch.

Deadline is exactly 2 weeks from this post, or in (expired on 2015-10-20 08:54:05).

In post 11, supercool898 wrote:Your vote can only be non-RVS if you were also saying mine was.

Is this true?

Assume everyone makes an RVS vote. If no-one can/should vote someone who made an RVS vote in a serious vain (because nothing can be read into them), then, what is the point of RVS?

Assume that no RVS vote can merit a serious vote.

All votes are RVS.

Proof: By Strong Induction.

Let {R0, R1.... RN...} to infinity be the set of all votes made in this game.

1) Base Case: R0 is an RVS vote because there is no prior content.

2) Inductive Step: Let RN be an arbitrary vote made in the mafia game.
Assume R0....RN-1 are arbitrary votes.
Since no prior votes are non-RVS votes, RN is an arbitrary vote.

Therefore, all votes are RVS votes.

QED.

In post 619, Nosferatu wrote:just wondering guys, how do you guys know it's mylo

In order for scum to win, there have to be the same number of scum players alive as town players (since they can then influence majority vote). In mislynch or lose, there are two more town players than scum players. Since one person always dies per night, if a second person is killed with the lynch, then the scum team wins.

There is also lynch or lose, where there is only one more town player than the number of scum players.
